abstract.text: An object that represents a text table as a whole.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A text table is responsible for laying out and drawing the text table blocks it contains, and it maintains the basic parameters of the table.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object for changing the values of the subattributes in a paragraph style attribute.
The paragraph or ruler attributes for an attributed string.
A block of text laid out in a subregion of the text container.
A section of text that forms a single list.
A tab in a paragraph.
An object that represents a text table as a whole.
These constants, specifying the type of text table layout algorithm, are used with
Returns the rectangle the text table block actually occupies, including padding, borders, and margins.
A Boolean value indicating whether the text table borders are collapsible.
Draws any colors and other decorations for a text table block.
A Boolean value indicating whether the text table hides empty cells.
The text table layout algorithm.
The number of columns in the text table.
Returns the rectangle within which glyphs should be laid out for a text table block.
A text block that appears as a cell in a text table.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
